SENT.plain: This article reviews our experience with 19 cases of Barrett oesophagus
Radiological findings included hiatus hernia, gastro-oesophageal reflux, strictures and oesophagitis
The strictures were most commonly distal
The recently described lace-like reticular pattern of the mucosa was noted in one case of the 15 who had air-contrast views
It was associated with an adjacent stricture
The low incidence of this radiological finding emphasises that Barrett oesophagus is a histological diagnosis
Six patients had only the non-specific and common radiological findings of reflux with or without hiatus hernia and one patient had a normal examination
These seven cases demonstrate the lack of suggestive radiological findings in some patients
